page.title: 05The Mineral Railway
page.content: The{Mineral Railway}passes through the eastern part of our area. It is carried over the A52 trunk road by a brick and steel bridge. The railway links{Cotgrave Colliery with{Ratcliffe-on-Soar Power Station twelve miles away. The whole of the output of coal from Cotgrave Colliery is sold to the Central Electricity Generating Board to be used at Ratcliffe-on-Soar Power Station. This is one of the many power stations which are to be found along the banks of the{River Trent. The Mineral Railway transports 25,000 tonnes of coal every week. The trains have up to 40 wagons and there are 40 trains each day for five days a week.
